# Pull Request

## Type of Change

- [ ] Adding a new tool
- [ ] Updating an existing tool (description, link, etc.)
- [ ] Removing an outdated/unmaintained tool
- [ ] Fixing a broken link
- [ ] Other (please describe)

## Tool Information (for new tools)

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Tool Name** | |
| **Repository URL** | |
| **Category** | |

## Checklist

### General Requirements
- [ ] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md](../CONTRIBUTING.md) guidelines
- [ ] The entry follows the correct format with Stars and Last Commit badges
- [ ] The tool is placed in the appropriate category
- [ ] The tool is placed alphabetically within its category

### Tool Eligibility (for new tools)
- [ ] The tool is open source with an OSI-approved license
- [ ] The repository is at least **1 month old** (anti-spam requirement)
- [ ] The repository has at least **5 stars**
- [ ] The tool has been updated within the last **12 months**
- [ ] The tool is pipeline-focused (CLI, API, or CI integration available)
- [ ] The tool serves a legitimate security function
- [ ] The tool has proper documentation (README with installation/usage)

### Anti-Spam Declaration
- [ ] I am **not** the owner/maintainer of this tool (or I have disclosed this below)
- [ ] This submission is **not** for SEO or promotional purposes
- [ ] The tool provides genuine value to the security community

## Disclosure

**Are you affiliated with this tool?** (maintainer, contributor, employee of the company, etc.)

- [ ] No, I am not affiliated
- [ ] Yes, I am affiliated (please explain below)

**Affiliation details (if applicable):**


## Additional Context

Please provide any additional context about why this tool should be included:


---

*Note: Our automated checks will verify repository age, star count, and recent activity. PRs that don't meet the minimum requirements will be automatically flagged.*
